This bridge takes you to Kumala Island from Tenggarong city. This bridge is quite long so dont forget bring a hat or an umbrella. But dont worry if you don’t bring it, you can rent there.
The ticket is 5000 rupiah for children and 10.000 rupiah for an adult.

Complete facilities... There are many tourist attractions on Kumala Island... the place is shady with shady plants... Very worth visiting...
stars.label: 5 stars

name: Firda Norma Alida
review: Tourist attractions that families must visit. Lots of unique spots that are cool for photos. The area is very wide. But don't worry, there are vehicle rental services (bikes and electric motorbikes). Many sell food and souvenirs too. Anyway, good place. The downside is that during the day the sun here is really hot.
stars.label: 5 stars

name: yopie franz
review:
This was the last destination we visited from a series of other tourist attractions in Tenggarong.

I thought it would be normal. It turns out that if you go out with friends it will be more fun here. Apart from of course if you bring your family.

Feel the sensation of walking on a bridge which sometimes sways slightly due to the wind.

You can take photos or record videos while on the bridge. Or take a photo of this bridge before crossing and from the direction of Kumala Island.

There is a paid entry ticket to the bridge. Cheap, only Rp. 7000/person.

Oh yes, there are lots of padlocks on this bridge. It seems like there is some sort of custom for young couples to put a padlock with their names on it here.

Nice bridge to see.

Recommended.
stars.label: 5 stars

name: Titik Setyawati
review:
How many times have you been here, it's always exciting, there is lots of transportation that can be rented here to explore all the places on this small island, there are bicycles, electric scooters, carriages, mini trains and many others, just choose which one with different rental fees. Yes, just adjust it to your budget.
It's just that the island is not well maintained in terms of cleanliness because it was closed some time ago. If you come here, make sure you bring food or drink because there's nothing to sell inside, so make sure before crossing the pedestrian bridge, look for supplies first 😁😁😁
But there aren't many photos when you come here, because it's always when your cellphone drops 😢😢😢
So just enjoy the tour fully
stars.label: 4 stars

name: Ros Aizam
review: When I came here there was painting, it was really nice to see the view from the top but I have a phobia of heights so when I wanted to look down my knees went weak 😅🤭 …
stars.label: 5 stars

name: Jerry Amnro
review: The bridge connecting Kumala Island, repo-repo which means lock. This place is very Instagrammable, and very suitable for couples who want to take photos, because you can put a padlock and write your name on the lock. It's best at dusk, the view is very beautiful. If you go to Tenggarong, you must come to this place
stars.label: 5 stars

name: Tara Andria
review:
Historical and iconic tourist attractions in Kutai Kartanegara Regency. When we board the plane, Kumala Island is very striking and is a sign that we are near the destination airport 😁
The motorbike and car parking area is spacious, the parking attendant is friendly. There are lots of food and drink vendors, so you don't need to be afraid of being hungry. When the sun is hot, there is also an umbrella rental service. To get to Kumala Island itself, we have to walk across the iconic Repo Repo Bridge.   It's quite a distance, so make sure to wear comfortable shoes and clothes. Entrance tickets are priced at 7000 per person. Inside there are electric motorbikes, bicycles for rental, and there is also an odong odong train that can be used to go around Kumala Island. Actually, this island is very beautiful, and has a lot of potential, but unfortunately the maintenance is not optimal. If it is not looked after and left to be damaged, it would be a shame. Please ask the local government to pay attention to this, so that it can compete with typical tourism in other regions.
stars.label: 4 stars

name: Satwiko Budiono
review: The Repo-Repo Bridge is truly captivating. This typical Kalimantan yellow color is very attractive. The surrounding view is also very good. If you go to Tenggarong, you really have to take a photo on this bridge. The photos produced here are definitely good, especially as the combination of the river, clouds and trees on the other side adds to the beautiful view on the Repo-Repo Bridge.
stars.label: 4 stars

name: Rikhsan Kurniatuhadi
review: The bridge that connects Tenggarong city to Kumala Island has its own attraction, namely as the main access to Kumala Island tourism and is suitable for taking selfies. Apart from that, there are many padlocks on the bridge to lock visitors' secrets.
stars.label: 5 stars

name: papayoga
review: The bridge that connects Tenggarong city with Kumala island in Kutai Kartanegara district. All you have to do is pay an entrance ticket of no less than 10 thousand rupiah and it is open almost every day from morning to evening. Worth visiting with family.
stars.label: 4 stars

name: Dewi Annisa Mamaraffiyya
review: A good and sturdy bridge and a bridge that can make people healthy, a bridge that connects Tenggarong city directly to Kumala Island by crossing on foot so that tourists can enjoy the beauty of Tenggarong city and can see the Mahakam river directly via this repo-repo bridge. Repo repo in Kutai language means key / padlock where you can put a love lock there, let's explore the city of Tenggarong and you have to stop by this repo repo bridge to continue exploring Kumala Island. Don't forget to bring a love padlock for young couples who want to immortalize their love on this bridge.
stars.label: 5 stars

name: Tia Julianti
review: The place is spacious. The entrance ticket is cheap. It's so wide that you won't find anything Balinese style 🤣 never mind coming here again. Rent a bicycle with a capital of IDR 30,000 until Gempor😂 not all of them are well maintained but it's okay for traveling …
stars.label: 4 stars

name: Heny Shahila
review: It's really nice to see the view from the bridge... I was there 2 years ago before the pandemic and this year I'm here again because of the pandemic, this place is temporarily closed. The guard said it had been closed for 2 years..
stars.label: 5 stars

name: budi setyawan
review: A cool place for natural tourism. Cheap entrance tickets. To get to Kumala Island you have to cross the bridge. Where on the left and right side of the fence there are padlocks installed. Usually young couples put a padlock on the fence as a manifestation of their love which will be as faithful as a pair of locks. Enjoy traveling around Kumala Island in the middle of the Mahakam river by renting an electric bicycle. Quite satisfied walking around. However, there are several locations that are poorly maintained. But it's worth it. If you are hungry and thirsty. In the Kumala Island area there are many food stalls and snacks. So let's vacation..
stars.label: 5 stars

name: Luthfi Yuliastika
review: One of the less well-maintained tourist attractions. It's a shame, even though it has a large area and lots of rides, it can attract lots of tourists. Cleanliness is well maintained. However, the rides, facilities, etc. are poorly maintained and many are damaged.
stars.label: 3 stars

review:

on the left and right sides of the bridge we can install love locks...
Those who are single or single will definitely be confused if they see a young couple installing a love lock here...

There is no charge to cross this bridge.

review: The bridge is one of the icons in Tenggarong city, a good photo spot with views over the river and city. It's quite safe when crossing this bridge because there is a fairly high fence, but be careful if you bring small children because there are still gaps in the fence that children can pass through and you can put a love padlock on the fence, but provide a padlock from home... It's a shame that Kumala Island like not taking care of it... (maybe due to the pandemic)

stars.label: 5 stars

name: put tips n trip
review:
Actually, this place has a good concept, there are islands connected by a bridge inspired by Europe, namely the Padlock of Love Bridge, located in the middle of Tenggarong city on the side of the main road
The parking lot is not maintained, there is no information center, there is only a security post under the bridge stairs. Thank God, they are the friendly ones who provide information to visitors. After crossing, there are different entrance tickets for adults and children.
All the infrastructure facilities have not been maintained for decades, there is a UFO tower, tourist train, water park, bird park. Traditional houses are all neglected and tend to be destroyed.
stars.label: 3 stars

name: hendi basuki
review: The bridge that stands over the Mahakam river connects the city of Tenggarong with Kumala Island. Good for a photo spot.
stars.label: 4 stars

review: The bridge has just been renovated and looks sturdy, clean and pleasing to the eye. The bridge is open 24 hours but entry to the island is only until 5 pm.
stars.label: 5 stars

name: reny Surya
review:
Can't move on from this place.
#Kumala Island is really amazing for me 🥰 …
stars.label: 4 stars

name: AFI DJ
review: Remember, it was still in 2007, the Tenggarong bridge was still standing solidly with the yellow color behind it. It looks really dirty from home. Here is another photo looking at the lembuswana statue. It's really big, my mother told me that this statue can fly because it has a mystical impression. Behind that, now it's really modern, lots of facilities have been built and it's cooler. Lots of good photo spots. And you can come here to refresh while discovering history because there is a museum of relics from the Kutai Kartanegara kingdom. It seems haunted but those who really like history can immediately come to Kumala Island in Tenggarong. In the past, access was fast. From Samarinda, you can cross directly on the Tenggarong bridge. Are you using boat access now? It's been a long time since I've been to Tenggaron. From Tenggarong to Kumala Island, take the Etek Etek boat, it only fits a few people. Don't be afraid, just enjoy it, the journey is a bit long. But it's really nice and beautiful.
stars.label: 5 stars

name: RtxStev
review: The place is really good but one thing, the place is a bit poorly maintained but it's still good
stars.label: 4 stars

name: Budi Arto
review: Lack of maintenance, so it feels less comfortable, even though there are actually quite a lot of spots that could be maximized as family recreation areas
stars.label: 4 stars

name: Nauval Fadillah
review:
It is very unfortunate that Kumala Island cannot now become a pleasant tourist destination. There are no rides that can be used, only electric bicycles and bicycles in general. Entrance ticket 7k.
Many places are not maintained even though it looks like someone is still cleaning them. It would be good for the Tenggarong city government to open up investors to manage this place. Make it a place to play considering the very large land

There are many historical relics, this place can also be used as an introduction to Kalimantan culture

as a gateway to enter Komala Island, it needs to be managed better.

traders, umbrella motorbike taxis and parking attendants seem wild. could be a threat to visitor comfort.

name: Rosmeilan Siagian
review:
To facilitate access for Tenggarong residents to Kumala Island, the Repo-Repo Bridge was completed in 2016 as a special pedestrian bridge that stretches over the Mahakam River. In Kutai language, "repo-repo" means "padlock". Therefore, there are love locks here although not many.
For easier access of Tenggarong people to Kumala Island, Repo-Repo Bridge was completely constructed in 2016 as a pedestrian bridge stretching over the Mahakam River. In Kutai language, "repo-repo" means "padlock". That's why there are love padlocks here though not many.

Hopefully in the future Kumala Island can be reopened to the public so that people can enjoy recreation with friends and family.

The parking attendants are also good because they come directly from the transportation department and it becomes more organized.
There is also a road divider on the bridge so it is not disturbed by people passing by
